original: Höglund, Hjallmar Hugo, sjukhusdirektör, Göteborg, f. 4/11/89 i’Gbg av Sven Johan H. o. Hulda Carlsson. G. 1. 13 m. Agnes Bengtsson, d. 44; 2. 46 m. Birgit Persson. Barn: Ingela f. 19, g. m. civ :ing. Sven Kristensson, Gbg. — Förest, f. Gbgs offentl. arb:-förmedk 27-33, socialstyr. omb. 30-33, sjukhusdir. i Gbg sed. 33. Inneh. ett stort ant. komm. o. a. förtr :uppdr., bl. a. ordf. i Gbgs-Postens persikl 15-19, i maskinsätt :sekt. 18-20, i Gbgs typogr. fören. 20-27, i typogr:förb. v. distr. 21-27, led. av styr. f. typogr förb. samma tid, ordf. i Gbgs-Postens driftsråd 26-27, distr :ordf. i Gbgs arb:-kommun 20-28, ordf. i Gbgs fackfören. centr iförs. 21-27, led. av stadsfullm. (s) sed. 21, ordf. i dess diskuss :kl. samt v. ordf. i dess socrdem. grupp, led. av stadskoll., drätselkamm., po-lisndn, arb :lös’h :komm., styr. f. arb:-förmedl, styr. f. Renströmska bad-anst., flicklärov., stadsteatern o. div. byggn:komm., ordf. i hälsovindn, sjukhusdirekt., valkomm., gatunamns-beredn., fam :bidr :ndn, sjuksköt :sk. o. semesterhemmet f. husmödrar, led. av länsarb :ndn, stadsförb. styr. o. dess sjukvårdsdeilegation, led. av div. kungl. komm., tillh. lOGT. Föret. uti. stud:-res.
translated: Höglund, Hjallmar Hugo, hospital director, Gothenburg, b. 4/11/89 in Gothenburg to Sven Johan H. and Hulda Carlsson. Married 1st in 1913 to Agnes Bengtsson, d. 1944; 2nd in 1946 to Birgit Persson. Children: Ingela b. 1919, married to civil engineer Sven Kristensson, Gothenburg. Previously held various municipal and other positions, including chairman of the Gothenburg Post's editorial board from 1915-1919, in the typesetting section from 1918-1920, in the Gothenburg typographers' association from 1920-1927, on the executive board of the Typographers' Union from 1921-1927, chairman of the Gothenburg Post's operations board from 1926-1927, district chairman of the Gothenburg Labour Committee from 1920-1928, chairman of the Gothenburg Trade Union Center for Commerce and Industry from 1921-1927, member of the city council (Social Democrats) since 1921, chairman of its discussion committee, and vice chairman of its social democratic group, member of the city inspection, finance committee, police commission, unemployment committee, Board of Labor, Board of the Renström Bath House, girls' schools committee, city theater committee, and various building committees. Also chairman of the Health Wind, Hospital Director, Election Committee, Street Name Committee, Family Allowance Board, Nursing School and Holiday Home for Housewives, member of the County Labour Board, City Federation Board and its Health care delegation, as well as various royal commissions, and a member of the IOGT (the International Organisation of Good Templars). Undertook study trips abroad.
